snippet: A three-judge panel upheld a ruling that the Army Corps of Engineers is liable for property owners’ claims, saying shoddy work on a shipping channel caused billions in damage during Hurricane Katrina.
abstract: Three-judge panel of the United States Court of Appeals for the Fifth Circuit upholds a ruling that the Army Corps of Engineers is liable for property owners' claims, saying shoddy work on a shipping channel caused billions of dollars in damage during Hurricane Katrina.
lead_paragraph: A three-judge panel upheld a ruling that the Army Corps of Engineers is liable for property owners’ claims, saying shoddy work on a shipping channel caused billions in damage during Hurricane Katrina.

headline.main: Louisiana: Army Corps Is Found Liable
headline.print_headline: Louisiana: Army Corps Is Found Liable
